hypothesis_templates: (tempA == tempB and tempB == tempC) implies (tempA == tempC)

training_data.comment: Zeroth Law: Verifying thermal equilibrium logic.
Zeroth Law: Negative Knowledge - If A=B but B!=C, then A!=C is not guaranteed by the law, but the implication holds.
2nd Law: Verifying that heat will flow from hot object A to cool object B.
2nd Law: Verifying the result of that heat flow - A cools down, B warms up.
Negative Knowledge: Heat does not flow from cold to hot.
